result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie A Forward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Uttering a Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**No jail credit, if revoked**
22CF273, 22CM90, 22CM95 are dismissed and read in. 
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 21CF1339, 21CF1347, 22CF96, 22CF101

miscConds.notes:
To be determined within 60 days. 
Plus 10% surcharge.
06/08/2022: Per order dated 6/5/22 Restitution is now $0.

No contact with any Fleet Farm location, Stay Bridge Hotel, any Northwestern Bank location. 
No contact with S.C., S.H., P.E., E.C., S.A., C.H., S.H., D.H., J.E., J.C., S.K.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie A Forward

records.addlTxt:
Amendment to Judgment of Conviction.
Restitution -0- None Requested.

(Cases 21CF1339, 21CF1347, 22CF96, 22CF101, 22CF273, 22CF476, 22CM90, 22CM95 are called at 3:16 PM- by Zoom)  Defendant Stephanie A Forward appeared by video, in custody from Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Stephanie A Forward.  Attorney Robert Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement- recites the joint sentence recommendation. Victim/Witness statute complied with. State makes additional comments regarding the offer by the State- additional counts, and probation conditions. Defendant agrees with all counts and probation conditions by the State. Defendant waives right to personal appearance. Defendant pleads Guilty to 21CF1339 Count 1, 22CF96 Count 1, 22CF101 Count 1, 22CF476 Count 1- Uttering a Forgery and 21CF1347 Count 1- Identity Theft- Avoidance. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including all of 22CF273, 22CM90, 22CM95. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 3 years Probation (concurrent to each other) with the following conditions: 120 days jail with Huber privileges or Electronic Monitoring on 22CF96 Count 1, all stayed pending further order of the court; AODA and follow through with recommendations; Maintain absolute sobriety; Restitution to be determined within 60 days in  21CF1347, 22CF96, 22CF476; Restitution in 21CF1339 in the amount of $261.54 plus %10 surcharge; Restitution in 22CF101 in the amount of $2,850.00 plus 10% surcharge; No contact with any Fleet Farm location, Stay Bridge Hotel, any Northwestern Bank location; No contact with S.C., S.H., P.E., E.C., S.A., C.H., S.H., D.H., J.E., J.C., S.K.; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders 2 days jail credit if revoked in 21CF1339, 21CF1347, 22CF96. Court orders 15 days jail credit, if revoked in 22CF101. Court orders no jail credit in 22CF476, if revoked.

9:48 AM Cases called: 21CF1339, 21CF1347, 22CF96, 22CF101, 22CF273, 22CF476, 22CM90 & 22CM95. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stephanie A Forward appeared by video, in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Stephanie A Forward. 

Defendant waives reading of Information in all felony cases and enters Not Guilty pleas are accepted in all cases. 20 days to file motions which can be extended for good cause. There may be a resolution.

STC and possible plea: 05/26/22 at 3:15pm - Defendant waives right to appear in person for todays proceeding. Can appear via video for the STC.

Cases called at 2:30 PM: 22CF96, 22CF101, 22CF273, 22CF476, 22CM90, 22CM95.
Defendant Stephanie A Forward appeared by video, in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Stephanie A Forward.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives her right to Preliminary Hearings.
Branch 2 to schedule ARGN.

(11:17 AM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Stephanie A Forward appeared by video, in custody in the Dunn County Jail. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Stephanie A Forward as a friend of the Court.
Attorney Rivard advises represents the defendant on Dunn County cases and is willing to stand by as counsel for today as a friend of the Court.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
